The crude fat content was determined by the AOAC ( 2016) method. Briefly, 5 g of the pulverized sample was extracted in 100 ml of diethyl ether for about 24 hr. The extract was filtered into a beaker of known weight ( W 1). It was thereafter made up to 100 ml with diethyl ether and shaken for another 6 hr; the filtrate was collected into W 1. The ether was concentrated to dryness in a steam bath and oven dried at 40–60°C, and then the beaker was weighed again ( W 2). The crude fat content was estimated as:
